**Spectral Weapon** is a level 3 [Charms](/Charms "Charms")/[Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") spell which summons a spectral clone of your melee weapon.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 See Also](#See_Also)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

A spectral weapon entity, matching your wielded weapon, is created. It will follow you and attack each time you do. Damage done is proportional to both spell power and weapon skill, as well as the weapon base type.

Half of any damage dealt to the spectral weapon will additionally be dealt to you, regardless of your defenses and resistances. Spectral weapons have one level of [resistance](/Resistance "Resistance") to fire, cold, electricity and poison. Their [AC](/AC "AC"), [EV](/EV "EV") and max [HP](/HP "HP") are proportional to [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power").

Spectral Weapon works on all melee weapons, including [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves"), except few [unrands](/Unrand "Unrand"): [Singing Sword](/Singing_Sword "Singing Sword"), [Mace of Variability](/Mace_of_Variability "Mace of Variability"), [Sword of Power](/Sword_of_Power "Sword of Power"), [Sceptre of Torment](/Sceptre_of_Torment "Sceptre of Torment") and [Devastator](/Devastator "Devastator"). Unwielding your current weapon dismisses your spectral weapon.

| Axe                                                                          | Long Blade                                                                                        | Mace                                                                            | Short Blade                                                                                          | Spear                                                                              | Staff                                                                              | Whip                                                                            |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [![Spectral Axe.png](/images/d/da/Spectral_Axe.png)](/File:Spectral_Axe.png) | [![Spectral Long Blade.png](/images/1/19/Spectral_Long_Blade.png)](/File:Spectral_Long_Blade.png) | [![Spectral Mace.png](/images/e/eb/Spectral_Mace.png)](/File:Spectral_Mace.png) | [![Spectral Short Blade.png](/images/7/78/Spectral_Short_Blade.png)](/File:Spectral_Short_Blade.png) | [![Spectral Spear.png](/images/f/f2/Spectral_Spear.png)](/File:Spectral_Spear.png) | [![Spectral Staff.png](/images/b/bc/Spectral_Staff.png)](/File:Spectral_Staff.png) | [![Spectral Whip.png](/images/a/a7/Spectral_Whip.png)](/File:Spectral_Whip.png) |

## Strategy

Spectral Weapon offers a significant increase in damage output. The main cost is strategic - the XP you need to cast the spell. Light armour makes it easier to cast, but lowers your defenses. Heavy armour provides good AC, but makes any spell difficult to cast.

Due to the damage splitting effect of this spell, avoid using it around enemies with area of effect abilities. [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud"), and [Hellfire](/Hellfire "Hellfire") are all things you don't want dealing 1.5× normal damage.

### Tips & Tricks

- [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") are often preferred with Spectral Weapon, since you can [reach](/Reach "Reach") over the weapon (and vice versa).
- Spectral weapons can't see [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") creatures, so don't rely on one when facing an [unseen horror](/Unseen_horror "Unseen horror") or invisible [sky beast](/Sky_beast "Sky beast") or the like.

## See Also

- [Dancing weapon](/Dancing_weapon "Dancing weapon")

## History

- Spectral Weapon was removed [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), along with the [Charms](/Charms "Charms") school. The [spectral](/Spectral "Spectral") brand was introduced in its place.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), Spectral Weapon's strength was based on weapon skill instead of spell power.
- Spectral Weapon was added in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").

Spectral Weapon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For the currently existing brand that creates spectral weapons, see spectral.

Draws out the spirit within a wielded weapon to fight for the caster, with its strength increasing with power. It only attacks when the caster does, and its kills count as the caster's own. If the weapon is damaged, part of the injury will be echoed on the caster's body. Only one spectral weapon can be maintained at a time, and only while the original weapon remains wielded.

Certain powerful named artefacts cannot be affected, and any abilities that require evocation skill to trigger will not be active.

Spectral Weapon is a level 3 Charms/Hexes spell which summons a spectral clone of your melee weapon.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 See Also
  • 4 History

Useful Info

A spectral weapon entity, matching your wielded weapon, is created. It will follow you and attack each time you do. Damage done is proportional to both spell power and weapon skill, as well as the weapon base type.

Half of any damage dealt to the spectral weapon will additionally be dealt to you, regardless of your defenses and resistances. Spectral weapons have one level of resistance to fire, cold, electricity and poison. Their AC, EV and max HP are proportional to spell power.

Spectral Weapon works on all melee weapons, including magical staves, except few unrands: Singing Sword, Mace of Variability, Sword of Power, Sceptre of Torment and Devastator. Unwielding your current weapon dismisses your spectral weapon.

Axe Long Blade Mace Short Blade Spear Staff Whip

Strategy

Spectral Weapon offers a significant increase in damage output. The main cost is strategic - the XP you need to cast the spell. Light armour makes it easier to cast, but lowers your defenses. Heavy armour provides good AC, but makes any spell difficult to cast.

Due to the damage splitting effect of this spell, avoid using it around enemies with area of effect abilities. Fireball, Freezing Cloud, and Hellfire are all things you don't want dealing 1.5× normal damage.

Tips & Tricks

  • Polearms are often preferred with Spectral Weapon, since you can reach over the weapon (and vice versa).
  • Spectral weapons can't see invisible creatures, so don't rely on one when facing an unseen horror or invisible sky beast or the like.

See Also

  • Dancing weapon

History

  • Spectral Weapon was removed 0.26, along with the Charms school. The spectral brand was introduced in its place.
  • Prior to 0.18, Spectral Weapon's strength was based on weapon skill instead of spell power.
  • Spectral Weapon was added in 0.13.
